3.1.1 Language of Page (Level A).title: Language missing or invalid
3.1.1 Language of Page (Level A).summary: The language of the document is not identified or a lang attribute value is invalid.
3.1.1 Language of Page (Level A).purpose: Identifying the language of the page or page elements allows screen readers to read the content in the appropriate language. It also facilitates automatic translation of content.
3.1.1 Language of Page (Level A).actions: Identify the document language using the <html lang> attribute with a valid value (e.g., <html lang="en">). Ensure that all lang attribute values are valid.

1.1.1 Non-text Content (Level A).title: Spacer image missing alternative text
1.1.1 Non-text Content (Level A).summary: A layout spacer image (which should have null/empty alternative text) does not have an alt attribute.
1.1.1 Non-text Content (Level A).purpose: Spacer images are used to maintain layout. They do not convey content and should be given null/empty alternative text (alt="") so they are not presented to users and are ignored by screen readers.
1.1.1 Non-text Content (Level A).actions: If the image is a spacer image, give the image null/empty alternative text (alt=""). Alternatively, consider using CSS instead of spacer images to control positioning and layout.

2.4.4 Link Purpose (In Context) (Level A.title: Empty link
2.4.4 Link Purpose (In Context) (Level A.purpose: If a link contains no text, the function or purpose of the link will not be presented to the user. This can introduce confusion for keyboard and screen reader users.
2.4.4 Link Purpose (In Context) (Level A.actions: Remove the empty link or provide text within the link that describes the functionality and/or target of that link.

1.3.1 Info and Relationships (Level A).title: Missing form label
1.3.1 Info and Relationships (Level A).summary: A form control does not have a corresponding label.
1.3.1 Info and Relationships (Level A).purpose: If a form control does not have a properly associated text label, the function or purpose of that form control may not be presented to screen reader users. Form labels also provide visible descriptions and larger clickable targets for form controls.
1.3.1 Info and Relationships (Level A).actions: If a text label for a form control is visible, use the <label> element to associate it with its respective form control. If there is no visible label, either provide an associated label, add a descriptive title attribute to the form control, or reference the label(s) using aria-labelledby. Labels are not required for image, submit, reset, button, or hidden form controls.

2.4.6 Headings and Labels (Level AA).title: Missing form label
2.4.6 Headings and Labels (Level AA).summary: A form control does not have a corresponding label.
2.4.6 Headings and Labels (Level AA).purpose: If a form control does not have a properly associated text label, the function or purpose of that form control may not be presented to screen reader users. Form labels also provide visible descriptions and larger clickable targets for form controls.
2.4.6 Headings and Labels (Level AA).actions: If a text label for a form control is visible, use the <label> element to associate it with its respective form control. If there is no visible label, either provide an associated label, add a descriptive title attribute to the form control, or reference the label(s) using aria-labelledby. Labels are not required for image, submit, reset, button, or hidden form controls.

3.3.2 Labels or Instructions (Level A).title: Missing form label
3.3.2 Labels or Instructions (Level A).summary: A form control does not have a corresponding label.
3.3.2 Labels or Instructions (Level A).purpose: If a form control does not have a properly associated text label, the function or purpose of that form control may not be presented to screen reader users. Form labels also provide visible descriptions and larger clickable targets for form controls.
3.3.2 Labels or Instructions (Level A).actions: If a text label for a form control is visible, use the <label> element to associate it with its respective form control. If there is no visible label, either provide an associated label, add a descriptive title attribute to the form control, or reference the label(s) using aria-labelledby. Labels are not required for image, submit, reset, button, or hidden form controls.
